content: increase 10 sts round 4-5 single_crochet in each single_crochet around 10 sts round 6 back post single_crochet in each single_crochet around or single_crochet around if you want a smooth tip without a ridge 10 sts round 7-16 10 rounds single_crochet in each single_crochet around 10 sts round 17 6 double_crochet popcorn see below slip_stitch in next single_crochet 6 double_crochet popcorn stitch slip_stitch in next single_crochet ifo do not finish round key ring option attach jump ring in round 17 on side opposite of popcorn stitches attach keychain ring to jump ring instructions for 6 double_crochet popcorn 1 work six double crochets into the same stitch it should look like a fan or shell 2 pull up the working loop on your hook so it s large and you don t have to worry about losing it then remove your hook from the loop 3 count back six double_crochet stitches and insert your hook into the first double_crochet you made 4 go through the loose working loop with your hook still in the first double_crochet once the loop is around your hook you can tighten it again 5 draw the working loop through the loops of the first double_crochet to close up and complete the popcorn a finished popcorn should look like a tiny cup made of double crochets jana whitley ravelry com april 2025
